recent_signals.headline: Fear-driven AI markets total $40B+, growing 20-45% CAGR — new economic category forming
Only 2% of AI layoffs from actual implementation — 98% anticipatory (HBR/Oxford Economics)
US AI trust at 32% (lowest major economy) vs China at 87% — massive adoption gap
AI application spend ($19B) exceeds infrastructure ($18B) — Perez Turning Point signal
Gulf SWFs deploy $66B in AI/digital — third global AI capital center forming
Global defense spending tops $2.6T; US DoD dedicates $13.4B to AI/autonomy
Japan -500K population/yr, 397 robots per 10K workers — demographic-automation nexus
China fertility 1.12, population declining 3 consecutive years — automation necessity
85% of AI startups expected out within 3 years; 42% fail from insufficient demand
Employee AI job-loss fear: 28% to 40% in 2 years (Mercer Global Talent Trends)
EU AI Act high-risk obligations effective Aug 2026 — regulatory divergence accelerating
95% of US manufacturers plan new automation within 3 years; 500K jobs unfilled
WEF: 170M jobs created, 92M displaced by 2030 — net +78M but 59% won't get training
Data center electricity: 2% to 4.4% of US total by 2030; hyperscalers restarting nuclear
Kearney Reshoring Index fell 311 points — intention vs execution gap widens
India median age 29.8, adding 183M working-age people by 2050 — demographic dividend peak
96% of music professionals open to paying more for human-created content — Human Premium real
Pro-AI super PACs raise $125M+ to influence 2026 midterms — AI becomes political wedge
Conference Board consumer confidence hits 12-year low at 84.5 — expectations below recession threshold
AI Ethics Consulting: $270M market at 45.9% CAGR — fastest growing fear-driven segment
